author: Special Correspondent
text:
The video surveillance team is investigating the genuineness of the compact disc containing the speech of B. Valarmathi, State Minister, on the poll code violation complaint preferred by the Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam.

R. Rajendran, secretary of the Salem Central district unit of the DMK, preferred a complaint with C. Vijaybabu, Revenue Divisional Officer and Returning Officer of the Salem North Assembly constituency, stating that Ms. Valarmathi, while addressing a public meeting held in the city on March 17, used abusive language against DMK chief M. Karunanidhi, treasurer M. K. Stalin, and Rajya Sabha member M. K. Kanimozhi, in violation of the election code of conduct.

The party men also handed over a CD containing the Minister’s speech to substantiate their claim, and sought action against her.

Mr. Vijaybabu said that the CD has been handed over to the video surveillance team and action will be initiated after the receipt of its report.

Meanwhile, A. B. Manikandan, a district panchayat councillor belonging to AIADMK, presented a petition to Mr. Vijaybabu urging him to mask the statue of late Veerapandi S. Arumugam, a prominent DMK leader, at the DMK district headquarters in the city.
title: Minister’s speech CD to be verified
